com.soa.json.xml

Class Xml2JSONSerializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.soa.json.xml.Xml2JSONSerializer

  • public class Xml2JSONSerializer
extends java.lang.Object
    Converts XML to JSON.

      • serialize

        public void serialize(java.lang.String xml,
                      java.io.Writer out)

        Converts an XML string to JSON using a Writer.

        xml - XML string.

        java.io.IOException

      • setRemoveNamespacePrefixes

        public void setRemoveNamespacePrefixes(boolean remove)
        Indicates whether namespace prefixes in XML element names should be removed when generating JSON names or not. The default is false.
        Parameters:
        remove - True if prefixes should be removed, false if not.

      • setIgnoreNamespaces

        public void setIgnoreNamespaces(boolean ignore)
        Indicates whether namespace declarations should be converted to JSON attributes or not (ignored entirely). The default is false.
        Parameters:
        ignore - True if namespace declarations should be ignored, false if they should be converted to attributes.

      • setForceTopLevelObject

        public void setForceTopLevelObject(boolean force)
        Indicates whether the root XML element should be a named JSON object inside an outer set of {}'s or treated anonymously as the root JSON object represented with the outer {}'s. For example, if true the XML string 1 will become { "a" : { "b": 1 } }. If false the same XML string will become { "b": 1 }. The default is false.
        Parameters:
        force - True to include the top level XML as a named JSON object, false to treat the root XML element anonymously.

      • setArrayElements

        public void setArrayElements(javax.xml.namespace.QName[] elements)
        Without direction JSON arrays are found by inspecting an XML element's children to see if there are more than one and if they are the same element type based on name. If there is only one child element though as an example, the serializer will have to conclude that the element is not an array. To avoid relying on the serializer to make this decision a list of XML element (local) names can be provided that the serializer should always treat as JSON arrays regardless of their content.
        Parameters:
        elements - list of XML element (local part) names.

      • setCreateArrayObjects

        public void setCreateArrayObjects(boolean createArrayObjects)
        Sets whether an outer JSON object using the name of the XML elements used as the array contents should be created. For example if the input XML is <a><b>1</b><b>2</b></a> with this setting false the output JSON would be { "a" : [ 1, 2 ] }. With this setting true the output JSON would be { "a" : { "b" : [ 1, 2 ] } }.
        Parameters:
        createArrayObjects - True to create wrapper object with child XML element name.
